intro: Pistolochia afghanica, commonly known as the Afghan pistolpod, is a climbing shrub native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces distinctive yellow flowers followed by elongated, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
